metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15708 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: Ubuntu's packaging of libvirt in 20.04 LTS created a control socket with world read and write permissions. An attacker could use this to overwrite arbitrary files or execute arbitrary code.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> This is ZDI-CAN-11561. caused by the switch to systemd socket activation, so bionic and earlier are not affected

criterions.comment: libvirt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
